taxon_identification.name_authority_date: Dichanthelium aciculare subsp. angustifolium (Elliott) Freckmann & Lelong

bio:treatment.description: Plants cespitose. Culms usually 35-75 cm, usually pubescent, at least on the lower internodes. Midculm blades 6-16 cm, usually glabrous. Primary panicles open, branches spreading, not appearing 1-sided. Spikelets 2.4-3 mm, narrowly obovoid to ellipsoid, often pointed to beaked. Lower glumes attached less than 0.2 mm below the upper glumes.
bio:treatment.discussion: Dichanthelium aciculare subsp. angustifolium grows in open pine woodlands, often in sandy soil with needle duff. It is restricted to the southeastern United States.
